DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study test effectiveness 1-session abbreviated cognitive-behavior therapy insomnia among college student . The investigator examine follow hypothesis present study : 1 ) Viewing treatment video produce increment sleep knowledge relative baseline minimum treatment control ; 2 ) Viewing treatment video result improve sleep relative baseline minimum treatment control . Students self-identify insomnia recruit University Alabama 's Psychology subject pool . Students enroll study receive link demographic screening questionnaire . Individuals history sleep disorder currently present symptom strongly suggestive sleep disorder , obstructive sleep apnea narcolepsy exclude . Individuals shift-workers history severe mental illness also exclude . Participants meet criterion study direct complete measure sleep knowledge . Once complete measure sleep knowledge , direct complete Consensus Sleep Diary ( CSD ) 14 day soon possible awaken morning . During second week complete CSD , participant direct complete Insomnia Severity Index Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System Sleep Disturbance Sleep-Related Impairments Short Forms last day complete CSD . Participants randomize treatment group minimum treatment control group upon completion baseline measure . Those treatment group email follow component insomnia treatment : link treatment video , mp3 file relaxation recording , pdf file brochure review information present treatment video . Participants ask view treatment video begin practice relaxation technique present mp3 file soon possible . Participants minimum treatment control group receive link sleep education video . Two week participant view video , ask complete post-treatment measure sequence baseline . One month post-treatment measure complete , group ask complete measure follow-up .
DOC.criteria: Must student The University Alabama Must 1824 year old Must complaint insomnia history sleep disorder insomnia symptom strongly suggestive sleep disorder insomnia shiftwork history severe mental illness ( e.g. , psychotic disorder , bipolar disorder , severe depression , personality disorder )
